# Mixed Citation Formats Test

This tests various citation formats used together.

## Single Citations

Individual references [5] are the most basic format.

## Comma-Separated

Multiple citations [1,3,7] can be grouped with commas.

## Semicolon-Separated

Some styles use semicolons [2;4;6] for grouping.

## Range Format

Consecutive citations [8-11] use range notation.

## Complex Mix

All formats together [1,2;3,5,8-11,15] show the parser's capability.

## Out of Order

Citations appear [15], [8-11], [1], [3], and [7] in various orders
throughout the document.

[1]: https://example.com/ref1
[2]: https://example.com/ref2
[3]: https://example.com/ref3
[4]: https://example.com/ref4
[5]: https://example.com/ref5
[6]: https://example.com/ref6
[7]: https://example.com/ref7
[8]: https://example.com/ref8
[9]: https://example.com/ref9
[10]: https://example.com/ref10
[11]: https://example.com/ref11
[15]: https://example.com/ref15
